Articles.Content:
RemoteTech 2 (by the Remote Technologies Group) is one of the most popular mods around right now, but a lot of people (including me!) have a hard time getting started. That's why I made a handy spreadsheet to help plan out your next planetary communications network. Just enter your desired orbit height and satellite count and it will calculate whether the network will work around each body in the Kerbol system, as well as tell you what antennas (or antennae?) you need to connect it all together. Hope it helps you out!

To download the RemoteTech mod, go here:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/83305-0-90-0-RemoteTech-v1-6-3-2015-02-06

Here is the spreadsheet:

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/agwmqnyixrdo7mc/AAC7mvok4xHrdGM_MoTuc-LQa?dl=0

P.S. If you find any bugs in this, please let me know below! Also feel free to suggest any ideas you have for other helpful reference spreadsheets and I'll see about making them a reality!

P.P.S. This is my first forum post, so if anything is horribly wrong with this post, just tell me and I will correct it.
Just getting into KSP with only 10h, didn't even know you had networks... I have a lot to learn!

If you need any help learning to use the RemoteTech 2 mod, this is where I myself learned how to do it:

http://remotetechnologiesgroup.github.io/RemoteTech/

Just getting into KSP with only 10h, didn't even know you had networks... I have a lot to learn!

Stock KSP doesn't have them, the Remotetech 2 mod adds the mechanic that probes and science returns require a communication link to KSC.
